channel.title: Dwarf cannons
channel.description: I'm using PI of course. I'm constructing a Dwarf cannon from scratch, so far I can build the cannon, store the balls into it, but how can i make it shoot at npcs, or even create the animation? I know it has to do with projectiles.

item.title: Dwarf cannons
item.dc:creator: @Coelho Coelho
item.description:
@Coelho wrote:

The 3D height above the ground it starts and stops at. Just guess until you get it right, it should be pretty simple.

Read full topic

item.title: Dwarf cannons
item.dc:creator: @imsuperman05 imsuperman05
item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Well… i did what you said, and now i’m stuck at something that is prob obvious but im tired.
To create the projectile, i need an int height… idk what the height means.

[code=java] public int getStartHeight() {
switch(c.MAGIC_SPELLS[c.spellId][0]) {
case 1562: // stun
return 25;

		case 12939:// smoke rush
		return 35;
		
		case 12987: // shadow rush
		return 38;
		
		case 12861: // ice rush
		return 15;
		
		case 12951:  // smoke blitz
		return 38;
		
		case 12999: // shadow blitz
		return 25;
		
		case 12911: // blood blitz
		return 25;
		
		default:
		return 43;
	}
}



public int getEndHeight() {
	switch(c.MAGIC_SPELLS[c.spellId][0]) {
		case 1562: // stun
		return 10;
		
		case 12939: // smoke rush
		return 20;
		
		case 12987: // shadow rush
		return 28;
		
		case 12861: // ice rush
		return 10;
		
		case 12951:  // smoke blitz
		return 28;
		
		case 12999: // shadow blitz
		return 15;
		
		case 12911: // blood blitz
		return 10;
			
		default:
		return 31;
	}
}[/code]

Read full topic

Yeah I remember that older server that had it never had the animation, but they made it face a new direction to a timer, they could rotate other objects too witch I’ve never seen since that.

item.title: Dwarf cannons
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

I heard something about each direction it faces is an object all on it’s own, but the server that was on was only up for 2 weeks so I don’t know. You could try and get the source to tell the objects the direction to face like that one tutorial with the NPCs.
